intro: Hiraea steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's hiraea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, white to pinkish flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
